news_0.author: Norman Sheikh
news_0.content: Sheikh Jassim also submits second bid after Sir Jim Ratcliffe
news_0.description:
Qatari banker Sheikh Jassim has joined Ineos owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe in submitting a second bid to buy Manchester United.
A representative for Sheikh Jassim said on Saturday they put in a revised bid overnight.
news_0.title: Man Utd takeover latest

news_1.author: Alamy
news_1.content: Wales' new era begins in Croatia
news_1.description: Some of the players have called it a "new era," while boss Robert Page has talked of "resetting and reframing" as Wales begin life without Gareth Bale.
news_1.title: Euro 2024 qualifying

news_2.author: Sebastian Modak
news_2.content: McIlroy & Scheffler advance at World Match Play
news_2.description: World number one Scottie Scheffler and Rory McIlroy both reach the WGC-Dell Technologies Match Play knockout stage with perfect records.
news_2.title: World Match Play Championship

news_3.author: test
news_3.description: When peace broke out among New York's gangs, breaking was born - but few foresaw it conquering the world and morphing into an Olympic sport.
news_3.title: How a New York gang truce spawned an Olympic sport

news_4.author: Alex Christian
news_4.content: The firms where it didn’t work
news_4.description: Nearly all firms that took part in the UK pilot are keeping reduced hours – but not all are fully embracing the new set-up.
news_4.title: Four-day workweek trial

news_5.author: Josie Cox
news_5.content: The Pressure Keeping US Worker Silent
news_5.description: A new law prevents companies from silencing former workers about their job experiences. The changes could be good – but they may not go far enough.
news_5.title: How we work

news_6.author: Amanda Ruggeri
news_6.description: Among social and economic considerations, more parents are foregoing siblings, choosing to stop at one child.
news_6.title: How we Live

news_7.author: Norman Miller
news_7.content: A fabled shellfish that nearly vanished
news_7.description: Mainly found on New Zealand's North Island, this large clam treasured by Māori coastal communities nearly became extinct due to exploitation. But now, it might be on the way back.
news_7.title: Toheroa

news_8.author: Richard Levine
news_8.content: The neighbourhood that epitomises New York
news_8.description: Travellers may go to Central Park or Times Square to see New York City, but there's no better place to feel the city's DNA and understand how it started than here.
news_8.title: Jackson Heights

news_9.author: Heather Jasper
news_9.description: Spanish adventure athlete Antonio de la Rosa attempted to row alone through the roughest seas on the planet to Antarctica. Very little went according to plan.
news_9.title: Adventure
